connector.description:
Stores JSON-formatted data into Opensearch.

The input data must be formatted in JSON according to the requirements of the index.

If you specify the `certificate` property, you must base64 encode it before you pass it as a parameter.

In the header, you can set the following properties:

- `indexId` / `ce-indexid`: The index ID for OpenSearch.

- `indexName` / `ce-indexname`: The index name for OpenSearch.

If you do not set a property in the header, the Kamelet uses the exchange ID for the index setting.

camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.user.name: camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.user
camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.user.description: The username to connect to OpenSearch.

camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.pass.name: camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.password
camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.pass.description: The password to connect to OpenSearch.

camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.enab.name: camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.enableSSL
camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.enab.description: Specifies to connect by using SSL.

camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.host.name: camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.hostAddresses
camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.host.description: A comma-separated list of remote transport addresses in `ip:port format`. Example: quickstart-es-http:9200

camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.clus.name: camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.clusterName
camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.clus.description: The name of the OpenSearch cluster. Example: quickstart

camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.inde.name: camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.indexName
camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.inde.description: The name of the OpenSearch index. Example: data

camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.cert.name: camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.certificate
camel.kamelet.opensearch-index-sink.cert.description: The Certificate for accessing the OpenSearch cluster. You must encode this value in base64.
